description:
Hello Bristol Gophers 👋!

We're bringing our talks online! This month we're looking at how to build services in Go, as well as the new gRPC tool - Buf.

Speakers:

🗣 Mat Ryer - How I write HTTP services after eight years

Mat recently went public with pace.dev, a minimalist project management tool. He's also a co-host of the popular go podcast - gotime As well as an experienced Go engineer, having worked with the language since before 1.0.

🗣 Johan Brandhorst - Buf

Johan is the maintainer of grpc-gateway, grpc-web, go-grpc-middleware. He's also working full time on buf. So he knows a thing or two about gRPC.

⏰ Schedule:

- 18:00-18:15 intro/welcome
- 18:15-18:45 first speaker
- 18:45-19:15 second speaker
- 19:15-19:30 workshop intro for next month/farewell/feedback

📣 We are looking for help with organising! If you or anyone you know would like to help, give us a shout! As you can see, our pun game especially is in dire need of a

📣Help us grow! JetBrains offers free licences to meet-ups with attendance greater than 30. If we can reach this, we will apply and be handing it out as a prize at events.

📍 - Online
title: Go(ne online) - Buf + Building services
